node.title: What will the opening of Queensland's borders mean for the state's least-vaccinated regions?
node.alt: A sign stands by the side of a country road, with text reading: Welcome to Cherbourg. Many tribes - one community.
node.description: With a weekÂ until the Queensland border reopens, authorities have warned that the virus will come and "hunt down" the unvaccinated.
node.content:
["With a week\u00a0until the Queensland border reopens, authorities have warned that the virus will come and \"hunt down\" the unvaccinated.", "So which\u00a0local government areas (LGAs) have the lowest vaccination rates, and what does reopening the border mean for those communities?", "Federal data for LGAs is calculated for those aged 15 and over, as opposed to state and national figures which are 16+.", "While the Central Highlands, Charters Towers and Mareeba aren't far off the 80 per cent mark for first doses (for those aged 15+), they've got a long way to go before they reach a similar number for double doses.", "But they're in a better position than Yarrabah and Cherbourg;\u00a0both are yet to hit 50 per cent fully vaccinated (15+).", "It's not all bad news though. Rates are climbing somewhat steadily.", "Yarrabah has seen 7.5 per cent growth in second doses administered in the last week, with Cherbourg not far behind with a 4.5 per cent increase.", "
What will happen in areas with low vaccination rates?
", "Gerard Fitzgerald from the school of Public Health at the Queensland University of Technology says time is\u00a0running out for those regions.", "\"Unfortunately, now it probably is past time, in terms of, this disease is going to spread before they will be properly vaccinated if they haven't already got first doses.\"", "Professor Fitzgerald says\u00a0areas with low vaccination rates will inevitably see outbreaks, putting\u00a0further strain on regional health services.", "\"When it does get into those communities it is going to spread and if there are people who have chronic diseases or are elderly then they will be at risk of severe illness.", "\"Add to the fact that they're severely ill, they are in communities where they don't necessarily have the critical care or the intensive-care infrastructure to be able to support them, so they'll have to be transferred to places that do.\"", "Low vaccination rates won't just impact unvaccinated individuals, but vaccinated people too.", "Professor Fitzgerald says if the virus is given the opportunity to spread, those who have tried to protect themselves through vaccination could still be put at risk.", "\"There will be people who are really sick for other reasons, they've got severe diabetes, severe respiratory disease or heart disease, where even a mild infection will be complicated and severe for them.\"", "It's a message echoed by\u00a0Linda Selvey from the University of Queensland's School of Public Health.", "\"Some people will get quite sick, particularly those who are not vaccinated, they'll potentially get quite sick and require hospitalisation and may die, that's the reality of it.\"", "
Is it too late to protect yourself?
", "Dr\u00a0Selvey says it should take a little while for the virus to reach the west of the state.", "And although the border is only days away from opening, there's still time for residents in communities with low vaccination rates to protect themselves.", "\"It's not too late at all, while one dose is not particularly effective against Delta it's certainly better than nothing, and you can be fully vaccinated within a month.\"", "And for those who want to take further precautions, she says wash your hands and dust off those masks.", "\"I wore a mask in the supermarket this morning even though our borders hadn't opened yet because we've had some community transmission in south-east Queensland recently.\""]
